app_summary: A social network with unidirectional follow relationships, implemented with loosely-coupled microservices, communicating with each other via Thrift RPCs. Supported Operations: Create text post (optional media: image, video, shortened URL, user tag), Read post, Read entire user timeline, Receive recommendations on which users to follow, Search database for user or post, Register/Login using user credentials, Follow/Unfollow user

symptoms.potential_symptom: Entry service reporting downstream Thrift errors / failed requests
symptoms.evidence: Traces (01ed62048e092576, 00207bc2f162f7c0, 023f467743b00d8a, 000ad093fb720bef) originate at nginx-thrift with has_error=true (traces_count=4). All traces show multi-hop Thrift sequences through compose-post-service and multiple downstream services and have error_message='; '. Latencies 4.397–5.515 ms. Suggests nginx-thrift is observing downstream RPC errors or propagated failures from the compose flow.

symptoms.potential_symptom: Orchestrator service making re-entrant or duplicated RPC calls (possible retry/loop) leading to errors
symptoms.evidence: All recorded traces show compose-post-service at the start and again at the end of the same trace (e.g., sequence fragment '... -> user-mention-service -> compose-post-service' and full sequences such as 'nginx-thrift -> compose-post-service -> ... -> compose-post-service'), with has_error=true (trace IDs: 01ed62048e092576, 00207bc2f162f7c0, 023f467743b00d8a, 000ad093fb720bef). Several traces also show multiple calls to the same downstream components within one request path, indicating re-entrancy or duplicate calls that may be causing the observed errors.

symptoms.potential_symptom: Downstream service invoked multiple times within single request (possible redundant calls or misrouted retries)
symptoms.evidence: Traces show user-mention-service appearing multiple times in the same trace (examples: '... -> user-mention-service -> url-shorten-service -> user-mention-service -> compose-post-service' and '... -> url-shorten-service -> user-mention-service -> url-shorten-service -> user-mention-service'), with has_error=true (trace IDs include 01ed62048e092576, 023f467743b00d8a, 000ad093fb720bef). Repeated invocations within a single compose flow suggest duplicate requests or callback loops involving user-mention-service.

rca_tasks.investigation_goal: Epicenter check: determine whether compose-post-service is introducing re-entrant / duplicated RPC calls (application bug) that cause trace loops and propagated errors to nginx-thrift. Test by (a) examining compose-post-service traces for repeated local spans/call IDs and end-of-trace re-entry, and (b) inspecting compose-post-service pods' recent logs for retry/loop behavior or misrouted client calls.

Connection check: verify compose-post-service's client config for post-storage-service and validate post-storage-service's Kubernetes Service definition (port/name) to catch URL/port/method misconfiguration causing duplicate/misdirected calls. Use compose-post-service deployment config/env to find the endpoint and confirm post-storage-service service matches.

Connection check: verify compose-post-service's client config for unique-id-service and validate unique-id-service's Kubernetes Service definition (port/name) to catch misrouted RPCs or incorrect clients that could trigger retries/duplicate IDs/back-and-forth calls.

Connection check: verify compose-post-service's client config for media-service and validate media-service's Kubernetes Service definition (port/name). Confirm media uploads/async callbacks are not incorrectly pointed back at compose-post-service or another service.

Connection check: verify compose-post-service's client config for text-service and validate text-service's Kubernetes Service definition (port/name) to rule out misconfigured RPC endpoints causing duplicate text processing calls.

Connection check: verify compose-post-service's client config for user-timeline-service and validate user-timeline-service's Kubernetes Service definition (port/name). This tests whether timeline update calls are being misrouted or retried into compose-post-service flows.

Connection check: verify compose-post-service's client config for home-timeline-service and validate home-timeline-service's Kubernetes Service definition (port/name). Confirm no port/name mismatch or wrong hostname that could cause timeouts/retries.

Connection check: verify compose-post-service's client config for user-service and validate user-service's Kubernetes Service definition (port/name). Rule out misconfigured user lookups triggering re-entrant logic.

Connection check: verify compose-post-service's client config for user-mention-service and validate user-mention-service's Kubernetes Service definition (port/name). Because traces show user-mention-service is called multiple times and appears with url-shorten-service, explicitly confirm compose isn't referencing an incorrect callback/endpoint for user-mention-service.

Entry service check: determine whether nginx-thrift is observing propagated downstream Thrift errors or introducing misrouting. Hypothesis: nginx-thrift is reporting errors because downstream compose-post-service is failing; verify by (a) inspecting nginx-thrift traces to confirm error spans reference downstream compose-post-service, and (b) checking nginx-thrift pods' config/logs for upstream hostnames/ports used for compose-post-service to rule out upstream misconfiguration.

user-mention-service app check: test hypothesis that user-mention-service is entering a callback/loop with url-shorten-service or is misconfigured to call back into compose-post-service, causing repeated invocations and contributing to trace loops and errors. Validate by (a) extracting traces filtered to user-mention-service to see repeated spans/entry points and (b) checking user-mention-service pod logs for outgoing calls to url-shorten-service or unexpected inbound handlers.

rca_analyses_list.diagnosis: compose-post-service is participating in and receiving re-entrant/duplicated RPC calls (trace loops) — traces show compose-post-service appears multiple times in the same traces (including both start and end), and those traces have errors. Pod logs show persistent connection refusals to post-storage-service (post-storage-service:9090) indicating downstream failures and repeated client retries that are propagating errors. Combined, this indicates an application-level RPC loop/re-entry involving compose-post-service (likely caused by cyclic/misrouted RPCs between services and amplified by post-storage-service unavailability), which is causing errors to propagate up to nginx-thrift.
rca_analyses_list.reasoning: Evidence 1 (traces): Multiple recent traces for compose-post-service (e.g., traceIDs 023f467743b00d8a, 01ed62048e092576, 0043fc7415d7b805, etc.) show the exact service sequence includes compose-post-service at the start and again at the end and sometimes mid-trace (examples: "... -> user-mention-service -> compose-post-service" and "... -> user-service -> compose-post-service"). All returned has_error=true. This directly demonstrates re-entry of compose-post-service within single traces (trace loops). Evidence 2 (logs): Aggregated pod logs for compose-post-service contain repeated, high-frequency "Failed to connect post-storage-client" / "Connection refused" messages for post-storage-service:9090 across many seconds, indicating downstream unavailability and repeated retry attempts. The combination of trace re-entry (service appears multiple times in traces) and persistent downstream connection failures (logs showing repeated Thrift connection refusals) supports that compose-post-service is involved in application-level RPC loops/duplicate calls and that downstream failures are amplifying the problem and propagating errors to nginx-thrift.

task.investigation_goal: Epicenter check: determine whether compose-post-service is introducing re-entrant / duplicated RPC calls (application bug) that cause trace loops and propagated errors to nginx-thrift. Test by (a) examining compose-post-service traces for repeated local spans/call IDs and end-of-trace re-entry, and (b) inspecting compose-post-service pods' recent logs for retry/loop behavior or misrouted client calls.

insights: Initial error-only trace query returned no results, but a full-trace query returned 7 recent traces (all has_error=true) — indicates the error-only filter did not surface these traces while they do exist in recent trace data

Multiple traces show re-entrant / looped call sequences where compose-post-service appears more than once in the same trace (examples include sequences ending in '... -> user-mention-service -> compose-post-service' and traces that start with compose-post-service and end with compose-post-service). This is direct evidence of application-level RPC loops or duplicated/misrouted calls involving compose-post-service

Aggregated pod logs for compose-post-service show persistent, high-frequency Thrift connection refusals to post-storage-service:9090 (repeated "TSocket::open() ... Connection refused" and "Failed to connect post-storage-client" entries) over many seconds — indicating downstream unavailability and repeated client retries from compose-post-service

Correlation of traces and logs: the trace loops (compose-post-service re-entrancy) coincide with persistent downstream failures, suggesting two contributing problems: (a) cyclic or misrouted RPCs causing compose-post-service to be invoked multiple times per request, and (b) post-storage-service unavailability causing repeated retries and error propagation

Final determination: compose-post-service is participating in re-entrant/duplicated RPCs (trace loops) and is also experiencing persistent failures communicating with post-storage-service. The combination (RPC loops + downstream connection refusals) explains the observed errors propagating up to nginx-thrift and the high error flags in traces

Confirmed hypotheses: compose-post-service appears in re-entrant traces and logs confirm downstream post-storage-service is refusing connections; these combined factors were used to produce the final diagnosis.

Fetched aggregated pod logs for compose-post-service using get_logs
Analyzed compose-post-service logs for downstream connection errors to post-storage-service:9090 (many 'Connection refused' / 'Failed to connect post-storage-client' entries)
Correlated data from traces and logs to identify relationship between re-entrant traces and downstream failures

args.diagnosis: compose-post-service is participating in and receiving re-entrant/duplicated RPC calls (trace loops) — traces show compose-post-service appears multiple times in the same traces (including both start and end), and those traces have errors. Pod logs show persistent connection refusals to post-storage-service (post-storage-service:9090) indicating downstream failures and repeated client retries that are propagating errors. Combined, this indicates an application-level RPC loop/re-entry involving compose-post-service (likely caused by cyclic/misrouted RPCs between services and amplified by post-storage-service unavailability), which is causing errors to propagate up to nginx-thrift.
args.reasoning: Evidence 1 (traces): Multiple recent traces for compose-post-service (e.g., traceIDs 023f467743b00d8a, 01ed62048e092576, 0043fc7415d7b805, etc.) show the exact service sequence includes compose-post-service at the start and again at the end and sometimes mid-trace (examples: "... -> user-mention-service -> compose-post-service" and "... -> user-service -> compose-post-service"). All returned has_error=true. This directly demonstrates re-entry of compose-post-service within single traces (trace loops). Evidence 2 (logs): Aggregated pod logs for compose-post-service contain repeated, high-frequency "Failed to connect post-storage-client" / "Connection refused" messages for post-storage-service:9090 across many seconds, indicating downstream unavailability and repeated retry attempts. The combination of trace re-entry (service appears multiple times in traces) and persistent downstream connection failures (logs showing repeated Thrift connection refusals) supports that compose-post-service is involved in application-level RPC loops/duplicate calls and that downstream failures are amplifying the problem and propagating errors to nginx-thrift.

rca_analyses_list.diagnosis: compose-post-service is configured to contact post-storage-service at post-storage-service:9090 (from its mounted service-config.json), but the post-storage-service Kubernetes Service maps port 9090 to targetPort 9999 (endpoints show pods at :9999). This port mapping mismatch indicates a service/pod port misconfiguration that can cause misdirected or incorrect RPC behavior.
rca_analyses_list.reasoning: 1) compose-post-service deployment mounts a ConfigMap with service-config.json (deployment describe). 2) service-config.json for compose-post-service explicitly configures post-storage-service.addr = "post-storage-service" and port = 9090. 3) The post-storage-service Service in namespace test-social-network exposes port 9090 but has TargetPort 9999 and Endpoints at 10.244.1.16:9999 (kubectl describe service). The client targets port 9090 while the Service forwards to 9999 on the pod — an inconsistency that should be reconciled (either update client config to use 9999 or change Service targetPort/pod container port to 9090).

task.investigation_goal: Connection check: verify compose-post-service's client config for post-storage-service and validate post-storage-service's Kubernetes Service definition (port/name) to catch URL/port/method misconfiguration causing duplicate/misdirected calls. Use compose-post-service deployment config/env to find the endpoint and confirm post-storage-service service matches.

insights: compose-post-service is configured (via mounted service-config.json) to call post-storage-service at post-storage-service:9090
The post-storage-service Kubernetes Service advertises port 9090 but forwards to targetPort 9999; endpoints show backend pods are listening on 9999 (10.244.1.16:9999)

There is a port mapping mismatch: client uses port 9090 while Service routes traffic to pod port 9999, causing a mismatch in expected RPC/HTTP endpoints and likely communication failures between compose-post-service and post-storage-service
Root cause: misconfiguration between Service targetPort/pod container port and client-configured port (either the Service should target 9090 or the client config should use 9999)

Remediation: reconcile port configuration by updating the post-storage-service Deployment/Pod container port to 9090 or change the Service targetPort to match the container port, or update the service-config.json to use port 9999 — ensure consistent port naming/values across client config, Service, and Pod
steps_performed: Analyzed compose-post-service pod template and volumes (noted no environment variables; reads service-config.json from ConfigMap)
Analyzed service-config.json within the ConfigMap (identified post-storage-service configured as addr: post-storage-service, port: 9090)
Analyzed post-storage-service Service ports and endpoints (found Service port 9090 -> TargetPort 9999, endpoint at pod IP:9999)
Correlated data from the ConfigMap (client config) and the Service description to identify a port mismatch between client expectation (9090) and Service backend port (9999)

args.diagnosis: compose-post-service is configured to contact post-storage-service at post-storage-service:9090 (from its mounted service-config.json), but the post-storage-service Kubernetes Service maps port 9090 to targetPort 9999 (endpoints show pods at :9999). This port mapping mismatch indicates a service/pod port misconfiguration that can cause misdirected or incorrect RPC behavior.
args.reasoning: 1) compose-post-service deployment mounts a ConfigMap with service-config.json (deployment describe). 2) service-config.json for compose-post-service explicitly configures post-storage-service.addr = "post-storage-service" and port = 9090. 3) The post-storage-service Service in namespace test-social-network exposes port 9090 but has TargetPort 9999 and Endpoints at 10.244.1.16:9999 (kubectl describe service). The client targets port 9090 while the Service forwards to 9999 on the pod — an inconsistency that should be reconciled (either update client config to use 9999 or change Service targetPort/pod container port to 9090).

message_history.content: Final diagnosis submitted successfully. Investigation complete.

final_report.root_cause: Two concurrent, related failures caused the incident: (1) compose-post-service contains an application-level re-entrant/duplicated RPC flow (trace loops) that causes it to call downstream services multiple times per request, and (2) compose-post-service failed to reach post-storage-service due to a port mismatch between the client config (post-storage-service:9090) and the Service/Pod port (Service targetPort -> 9999 / endpoints at :9999). The port mismatch / downstream connection failures caused repeated retries and connection refusals in compose-post-service which amplified error propagation; the application-level RPC loop/re-entry then caused multi-hop traces to include compose-post-service multiple times and produced the observed errors at nginx-thrift.
final_report.evidence_summary: 1) Traces (IDs 01ed62..., 00207b..., 023f46..., 000ad0...) show compose-post-service appearing more than once in individual traces (start and again later), multiple repeated calls to the same downstream services (user-mention-service, url-shorten-service), and has_error=true on all these traces. 2) compose-post-service pod logs contain repeated 'TSocket::open() ... Connection refused' / 'Failed to connect post-storage-client' entries targeting post-storage-service:9090. 3) compose-post-service client config (service-config.json in its ConfigMap) uses post-storage-service:9090. 4) post-storage-service Kubernetes Service advertises port 9090 but has targetPort 9999 and endpoints at podIP:9999, indicating a port mapping inconsistency between client expectation (9090) and service/pod configuration (9999). Correlating traces + logs + config shows compose-post-service is both participating in trace loops and failing to connect to post-storage, producing retries and propagated errors up to nginx-thrift.
final_report.investigation_summary: Priority-1 investigation (completed): examined full traces and aggregated compose-post-service pod logs. Found repeated re-entrant traces where compose-post-service appears multiple times in a single request path and persistent connection refused errors to post-storage-service:9090 in compose-post-service logs, indicating retries and failure propagation. Priority-2 investigation (completed): inspected compose-post-service ConfigMap (service-config.json) and post-storage-service Service. ConfigMap configures post-storage-service port=9090 while the Service forwards to targetPort 9999 and endpoints show pods at :9999 — a port mismatch. Steps taken included get_traces, get_logs, kubectl describe of deployments/ConfigMap/Service, and correlating trace and log timestamps and call sequences. No further data required to conclude the root cause.

evaluation.rca_motivation: The agent correctly identifies the key real root cause: a port mismatch preventing compose-post-service from reaching post-storage-service, explicitly noting targetPort 9999 vs expected 9090, which matches the chaos injection. However, it adds a substantial, unsubstantiated second cause (application-level RPC loop), going beyond the injected issue.
